lines: There is some kind of force field. And it’s surrounding the only other door in this room on the opposite end of the pit that you’re currently standing over.

speaker: Redmond
lines: So you help me rob this bank, it’ll take five minutes. I know you’re in a hurry.

speaker: Taako
lines: Hell yeah!

lines: Isaak’s next-to-last entry in Isaak’s journal reads

speaker: Isaak
lines: From the moment I saw it, was I knew there was nothing I wouldn’t do to get that cup, I just didn’t know why. I killed Jack. I saw my prize, the cup I had killed my very best friend for, in June’s hands.

speaker: Taako
lines: Junebug.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Roswell says,

speaker: Roswell
lines: What would you like me to do?

speaker: Announcer
lines: I hope these boys never find my journal. My LiveJournal, that is. Unless you want to hear all about My Chemical Romance. It’s The Adventure Zone!

speaker: Travis
lines: All right, I have an idea, fellas. Go with - Go with me on this. [noise of soda can opening]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Roswell. Junebug.

lines: Okay - yeah, what- what do you need?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Go get the chalice for us.

lines: That’s good, that’s very good.

speaker: Travis
lines: I thought maybe that might work.

speaker: Clint
lines: Forty-five seconds in, done.

speaker: Roswell
lines: I’m sorry- I’m sorry. I don’t understand what you’re talking about.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Dunk.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You are in that moment right after what just happened at the end of the last episode. You now know Roswell’s command word. It is 1153. You’re still at the end of that same loop, and sorta the clay has been cleaned up, pulled back into Roswell’s form. Merle and Magnus, you’ve both sort of recovered. And yeah, it’s 1153 and Redmond finally walks into the bank, and that elf wizard is with him. And they’re holding the lockbox that had that big bomb in it. They both kind of nervously look at Roswell as they walk in but kind of don’t- aren’t- don’t seem too afraid of them because Roswell’s not, like, now attacking anybody.

speaker: Travis
lines: No, everyone’s being cool. We’re all being little fantasy Fonzies.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Everyone’s being really cool, and Redmond says,

speaker: Redmond
lines: Well, it seems like everything went pretty- pretty well in here, all things considered.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I don’t know how. Got really confused halfway through what was happening there, but.

speaker: Redmond
lines: What was in the vault? I gotta know.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Taako-

speaker: Taako
lines: Gems.

speaker: Merle
lines: Food. There was some sandwiches.

speaker: Magnus
lines: [stage whispering] Taako, Merle, they’re not gonna remember this anyways, fuck it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Redmond sends the elf that’s with him into the vault to poke around, look around. Redmond says,

speaker: Redmond
lines: Well, it didn’t seem like it was the prettiest job, but I gotta say, you got it done.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Listen, Redmond, we’re pretty short on time here, fella. We did the thing for you, and we will tell you what’s in the vault, but we need you to come with us to your brother to do what you can with the Temple of Istus. That was the deal.

speaker: Redmond
lines: Okay, yeah, no, just give me like fifteen minutes or so if you don’t mind.

speaker: [crosstalk; all of Tres Horny Boys disagree]
Magnus
lines: Nope, nope, nope, gotta go now.

speaker: Redmond
lines: It really - it really can’t wait?

lines: Okay. Roswell, grab him.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, okay. Roswell says,

lines: And kind of just bear-hugs Redmond. And Redmond’s like,

lines: Give him a backrub!

lines: This is unnecessary! This is unnecessary.

lines: Okay, we’re going to the temple. Come on, Roswell.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, and Roswell is now sort of- Roswell says,

speaker: Roswell
lines: Okay, you got it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he walks-

speaker: Taako
lines: Put him on your- put him on your shoulders like a toddler.

speaker: Merle
lines: Aww!

speaker: Magnus
lines: Aw, that’d be cute. Watch the doorways.

speaker: Clint
lines: Clunk!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, kinda fireman-carries him out of the building and does bonk his head on the side of the door as Roswell carries Redmond out of the bank. It’s 1154.

speaker: Magnus
lines: And just remember, this bank was robbed by The Wet Bandits! [Griffin and Clint laugh]

speaker: Justin
lines: Griffin, can you roll to see if him bonking his head killed him? [Travis laughs]

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, it was--I actually rolled a critical miss, so the bank falls down, I guess. I think that’s how it works.

speaker: Clint
lines: [laughs] It’s going to.

speaker: Justin
lines: That’s a bad bank.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, yeah. It’s 1154. Your--you actually see Horsey, Magnus, the horse that you stole, essentially, during the last episode--runs up through the woods and kind of goes to the water trough in front of the sheriff’s office where it was before.

speaker: Travis
lines: All right, so do we want to horse-and-Garyl this?

speaker: Justin
lines: That’s like a high-level spell slot.

speaker: Travis
lines: You’ve got fucking five minutes! Hold on, I’ll take Redmond and Horsey. Merle and Taako, you do Garyl.

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh, no no no. Not after last week. No, nuh-uh, I’m not putting up with that Garyl horseshit.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I’m pretty sure you rode on the other horse last week.

speaker: Clint
lines: I did! I know, but last week Garyl called me dense and fat and heavy.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay well, how fast is Roswell, Griffin?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um, not the fastest.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: I’ve summoned, uh, I’ve summoned Garyl.

speaker: Clint
lines: [quietly] Oh shit.

speaker: Garyl
lines: I hope you like walking, lil man. Get on. I’d love-- As much as I’d love the grand spectacle of watching those stubby little legs pump their way all the way to wherever the hell we’re going, I ain’t gonna see it today. Get on.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh--

speaker: Merle
lines: Hi-oh, Garyl! Away!!

speaker: Garyl
lines: Don’t talk to me, little man.

speaker: Merle
lines: Okay, sorry.

speaker: Travis
lines: [laughing]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, Redmond, is like down to go with you and help you out, he doesn’t need to be restrained.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay. He does have to be little spoon though and ride in front of me. I don’t trust him.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says, uh,

speaker: Redmond
lines: That’s how I prefer it!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And uh, little spoons on ya. And uh yeah, you ride up the, uh, the path up the side of the plateau to the west of town, and you get to the cave at that plateau, and it’s about 1157 [Justin Shit.] as you make your way inside and dismount and run into the cave. And as soon as you do you see Luca, the skeleton brother, and uh seeing that Redmond is in the cave they sorta don’t do their - he doesn’t do his act of pretending to be dead, and he says

speaker: Luca
lines: Brother! Have you finally -

speaker: [chorus of the boys repeating “brother!” like “bruhtha!” and laughing, possibly a Metal Gear Solid reference]
Luca
lines: Have you returned to your senses? Who are these gentlemen with you?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Redmond says, uh,

speaker: Redmond
lines: There’s not much time, Luca! These men have business with Istus. I told them we’d try and raise the temple!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Luca says,

speaker: Luca
lines: Well then, come and sit with me, weary travelers! Tell me your life’s journey! [protests from Magnus] I would like to hear the winding paths that Our Lady of Fate has led you down. If you wish, I could start with my own autobiography.

speaker: Magnus
lines: No, we have, like, three minutes!

speaker: Luca
lines: You don’t want to hear about the beautiful, rolling foothills of Starhollow that--

speaker: Magnus
lines: You can tell us at 1201!

speaker: Merle
lines: Yes, in five minutes you can tell us that story.

speaker: Luca
lines: Uh, okay if you insist.

speaker: Merle
lines: [in Clint’s voice] And by the way, when we say “raise the temple,” we mean R-A-I-S-E, not R-A-Z-E.

speaker: Justin
lines: Do it again. Do it again. Take that whole conversation again. Take it from the top --

speaker: Merle
lines: By the way --

speaker: Justin
lines: We’re wasting time.

speaker: Merle
lines: [speaking faster] When we said raise we meant R-A-I-S-E, we don’t mean R-A-Z-E.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Unfortunately, that was the time that I needed to blow up the town. And let that be a lesson to you now, Dad. If you don’t use your character voice, [Travis People die!] then the apocalypse happens.

speaker: Clint
lines: [dramatically] People die!

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, you manage to get Luca out in time and you--I think all of you just sprint the short distance from the cave to the temple and it’s 1159 and Redmond rolls out a little mat in front of the fallen temple and the two brothers get on their knees and they place their hands together and they start to do this prayer. And they say,

speaker: Luca and Redmond
lines: Lady of Fate, Mother Istus, author of the story of life, and the nurturer of passing time, we beseech these things in your name. Raise this temple so that--

speaker: Griffin
lines: And like, as soon as they say “raise this temple,” it starts to like rebuild itself in a hurry and it starts to de-age, if that’s a--if that’s a verb. It starts to young-ify. And the walls sort of rebuild themselves. You see the curtains that were laying on the ground, they just sort of lift themselves into the air and they snap perfectly over the windows-

speaker: Travis
lines: Griffin, I would like to do a carpentry check to see if I’m impressed by how it’s building itself.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, sure.

speaker: Travis
lines: I never get to use that skill.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I mean, that’s not a skill per se. Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: [dice rolling] Alright, that’s an eighteen! And I think I add ten cuz I’m super good at--

speaker: Griffin
lines: You add a hundred to that, yeah. No, yeah, it’s super impressive. I mean, you can also tell that, like, this thing was built pretty well for the limited resources that were available to whoever built it.

speaker: Clint
lines: Praise Istus!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And the steeple starts to right itself, sort of casting a shadow over your party and as it’s rebuilding itself you hear the clock start to chime behind you. And the final piece, those two double doors facing the town, they snap into their frame right as you hear that anguished roar coming from the purple worm. And from your vantage point, you see the city of Refuge start to buckle and collapse in on itself, and the double doors swing open and you hear a voice beckoning you from within.

speaker: Travis
lines: I go. Magnus rushes in!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Kay.

speaker: Justin
lines: This is one instance in which Taako is not good out here. Taako will follow.

speaker: [The Temple of Istus starts to play in the background]
Griffin
lines: Okay. As you’re running in, the two brothers, who still have their eyes closed and heads bowed in prayer, are just like,

speaker: Luca and Redmond
lines: [saying with quickened pace each time] Go, go, go, go, go, go, go!

speaker: Travis
lines: And I turn back and like,

speaker: Taako
lines: Sorry about this!

speaker: Magnus
lines: Later dudes!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Merle, are you rushing in as well?

speaker: Clint
lines: I-- yeah, peace out. I’m gone.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, yeah. All three of you run into the temple and you do so as, like, that explosion was coming. But as soon as you cross through the threshold of the door, there is no explosion, there is no calamity. And when you look back through the open doors you can see the two brothers still kneeling but they’re, like, backlit by fire. But in here, inside the temple it’s completely still. You see the rows of pews lining an aisle leading up to a fairly humble pulpit. Behind that is a tapestry showing a city of happy, busy people all nestled in the embrace of a beautiful woman with long, flowing, white hair. And that woman is in front of you, in the flesh.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Hail and well met!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Or whatever gods are made of. And as you call out to her, she looks up from -- she’s knitting something as she sort of sits on the steps leading up to the pulpit. And she looks up and says,

speaker: Istus
lines: Well, the three of you are --

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well, let me do a voice.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, please, come on. Set a standard for the rest of us.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says,

speaker: Istus
lines: Well, the three of you are… Are just in time.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And she puts her knitting down. And the three of you are standing before an actual, literal goddess. What do you do?

speaker: Merle
lines: Let me handle this, guys. Kinda my area of expertise.

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, okay.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Oh, god. I’m so scared.

speaker: Merle
lines: [seductively] How you doin’?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Oh, god. No, no, nope, nope.

speaker: Taako
lines: Cool, okay. Not as bad as it could have gone.

speaker: Merle
lines: Love the hair.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Could have been worse.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She kind of laughs and sort of runs her hand through her hair which is like, it’s kind of shimmering silver with like a tinge of blue. And she says,

speaker: Istus
lines: Oh, thanks, I’ve had it for a while.

speaker: Merle
lines: All hail mighty Isthmus.

speaker: Istus
lines: It’s, uh, it’s Istus, actually. [laughter] There’s not --

speaker: Merle
lines: Merry Chr-Istus. Merry Chr-istmus, mighty Istus.

speaker: Istus
lines: I don’t blame you for not knowing about me. I’m sort of an older goddess in this realm. My followers are few and most of them are somewhat lacking in devotion. It’s hard to get behind a goddess who’s all about enforcing the whims of fate when, you know, the whims of fate deliver nothing, but mass destruction upon you. But it’s good to see the three of you.

speaker: Magnus
lines: It’s good to see you as well, m’lady Fate.

speaker: Merle
lines: Oh god.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Just go with me on this!

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says—

speaker: Travis
lines: I’ve got Rustic Hospitality coming out of my ass! Everybody loves Magnus!

speaker: Griffin
lines: How—I wanna ask the question, how the three of you--because you’ve never—I want to impress upon you, you’re standing in front of a deity, and I don’t think that’s happened to any of you before, and I just wanna know how that treats you.

speaker: Travis
lines: I would say that Magnus is not religious, but he’s very spiritual.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [laughing] Okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: Taako doesn’t get the appeal. I mean, they can do magic, he can do magic. He feels like they’re just about equal.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: Merle’s rocked to his very core.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright, good.

speaker: Travis
lines: You have a hand from a god!

speaker: Clint
lines: Well, yeah, oh gosh, thanks for the wood hand, God!

speaker: Travis
lines: But I’m saying like, this isn’t the first divine proof you have received. [pronounced like receiv-ed]

speaker: Clint
lines: Well, maybe I’m looking for a better deal!

speaker: Travis
lines: Keep that on the DL.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yep. [Whispering] Better deal!

speaker: Justin
lines: Yup.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Istus beckons all of you to come in through the entryway and motions for you to sit down in the front row of pews and have a chat with her. And she says,

speaker: Istus
lines: Look, I’m not telling you anything you don’t already know but this town is sick. Obviously, the whims of fate aren’t being obeyed as much as they’re being made a mockery of, and the force that’s wielding the Temporal Chalice is forcing everyone in this town to relive the same horrible day, the same horrible hour, over and over again. That’s not right. And you may find this upsetting, boys, but you are dying. Time isn’t- isn’t rewinding every day at noon, it’s repeating for everyone. But for some reason the Temporal Chalice, or whatever’s wielding it is allowing you to remember the loops.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Wait, hold on. So we are dying?

speaker: Istus
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Magnus
lines: So when this is all done, are we gonna be dead?

speaker: Istus
lines: Not if you get out after a loop that you survive. And that’s maybe something I can help you out with.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says.

speaker: Taako
lines: Although, if we got out after a loop that we died during, that would be a hell of a thing, huh.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah, right wouldn’t that be - that would be like waking up dead, am I right?

speaker: Taako
lines: I don’t wanna get into semantics here -

speaker: Istus
lines: Okay, you really razzed me there.

speaker: Taako
lines: [laughing] That’s me!

speaker: Clint
lines: That’s Taako!

speaker: Travis
lines: So you get Taako, baby!

speaker: Taako
lines: That’s Taako.

speaker: Travis
lines: Which season you get?

speaker: Taako
lines: Uncut!

speaker: Griffin
lines: She uh, she uh, she says, uh -

speaker: Istus
lines: Uncut. [Griffin She says,] Huh. That’s funny.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And she reaches into this white tunic that she’s wearing and she pulls out a small pair of scissors?  And she cuts a loose string out of the scarf that she’s knitting - and but she does it in kind of a vaguely intimidating way? And that string falls to the floor. And she tucks the scissors back -

speaker: Justin
lines: Alright, Taako’s appropriately intimidated.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Um. She says, um-

speaker: Justin
lines: Nah, I’m gonna need- have her make an intimidation check.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. [rolls dice] Uh, 19? I don’t know what I’m rolling against there.

speaker: Justin
lines: Ahhh, let’s just say that probably did the job.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, he’s intimidated.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um. She says, uh, she puts her knitting down again and she says-

speaker: Istus
lines: The three of you are just so special.  You know that right? Like, our existence is made up of countless realities where the same people are just doing the same actions at the same time in parallel worlds throughout the echoes of creation— except for YOU! The-the three of you are the only three of you that there are, doing the things that the three of you do here in this world. I— wh- when I say that you’re unique, I’m not being flattering, I’m being quite literal.

speaker: Taako
lines: I think we assumed that our, uh, the way we were different was just because we weren’t here when this uh, spell got cast.

speaker: Istus
lines: I’m not even talking about this town, Taako. I’m ta- I’m talking about all of it! The-the-the-the world, the plane, the planar system, reality, existence, all of it! The three of you are anomalies! I certainly, you know, have god-like powers, I don’t like to brag, but uh— I don’t- I’ve never known anything like the three of you. And I don’t know why that is but I’m intrigued. Because whether you realize it or not, you’ve been serving as my agents for longer than you could ever remember. You’ve—

speaker: Magnus
lines: How far back?

speaker: Istus
lines: Really, really far back!  Yeah, I mean—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Like two weeks?

speaker: Istus
lines: Much farther than that.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Three weeks?

speaker: Taako
lines: Don’t say three— not three weeks!

speaker: Magnus
lines: Naw! Three weeks?

speaker: Taako
lines: Three?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Three weeks?

speaker: Istus
lines: Almost your entire lives, the three of you have been preventing things that go against the designs of fate from happening; stopping powers that would reshape reality used by people who shouldn’t be using them! And—and that’s my whole jam.

speaker: Magnus
lines: But, Istus—I’m sorry, but there is some really shitty stuff that’s happened in all of our lives!  Like—do you like, just uh, like, I dunno, Phandalin? That kinda sh—that’s what supposed to happen?

speaker: Istus
lines: No, it wasn’t. That was one that you kinda goofed up on.

speaker: Taako
lines: That was a goofer!

speaker: Merle
lines: That was one! Okay.

speaker: Magnus
lines: That’s a mulligan!

speaker: Istus
lines: But you tried to stop it! That’s what I’m saying! T-the three of you have been serving as my agents for so long and you’ve done so much great work here in Refuge. T-the—probably the most fucked up, fate-defying place that ever was or ever will be. A-and you’ve done so much to try to stop it and—I wanna ask you to make it formal. I want you to become my emissaries in this world. And if you do, I-I will grant you my blessing.

speaker: Taako
lines: Hmm.

speaker: Merle
lines: We’ve already got a gig!

speaker: Magnus
lines: W—what’s that, uhh, what’s that entail?

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah!

speaker: Istus
lines: Just keep doing what you’re doing - [Justin Cool!] [Travis Done!] [Clint O-oho yeah!] just stop the—stop [Travis You got it!] - keep standing in the way of forces that want to reshape creation in their—in-in their image following their will and not the will of fate.

speaker: Taako
lines: Listen, if we pledge our allegiance to you, does that mean I get to watch Merle’s hand fall off?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Good question!

speaker: Taako
lines: ‘Cause if so—Yes.

speaker: Istus
lines: Oh, you’re talking about Pan, right?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeeesss.

speaker: Taako
lines: Did or- Dan, as I’ve come to know. Yeah, Pan! Pan the man?

speaker: Istus
lines: I call him - I call him Dan as well! That’s amazing! Merle - Pan and I are best buds, w-w-we have a weekly poker night over in the celestial plane so don’t even sweat that. I don’t think he’s gonna hold this charge against you.

speaker: Magnus
lines: What kind of bennies do we get?

speaker: Istus
lines: Uh— many bennies!

speaker: Griffin
lines: - she says and smiles.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I’ll take it! I’m don-Yeah! Where do I sign? How bout we do this as like a trial basis, we make this one the test run of how this goes. And if we make it to the other side of this whole time loop thing and survive, we’re good to go.

speaker: Istus
lines: I mean, I guess I can live with that, I haven’t seen you do anything so far that has defied Fate’s will so I-I— you’ve earned a certain amount of trust, I suppose.

speaker: Travis
lines: I stick my hand out.

speaker: Istus
lines: ...we don’t have to hand shake. You actually— in fact, you shouldn’t touch me.

speaker: Travis
lines: I keep my hand out.

speaker: Clint
lines: We really ought to have our lawyers look at this.

speaker: Istus
lines: I just—I think you might explode.

speaker: Travis
lines: I go for a high five instead!

speaker: Istus
lines: That would double explode you, yeah, that’s a super duper bad idea.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Okay, cool. Cool, cool. Cool.

speaker: Travis
lines: I put my hand down, but I high five myself quietly.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says, uh—

speaker: Istus
lines: Taako, Merle, you- are you interested?

speaker: Merle
lines: Okay!

speaker: Magnus
lines: Cool, so it seems like, uh, two of three?

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, I’m fine.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah, we're good, yeah.

speaker: Taako
lines: Is it more work?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Good question.

speaker: Istus
lines: I-ideally, it'll be the same amount of work. I’m sorry it won't be less work.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Could it be less work?

speaker: Istus
lines: No I don’t think—I know that's Taako's sort of whole—

speaker: Taako
lines: Let’s talk God powers.

speaker: Merle
lines: Is there judgement involved?

speaker: Istus
lines: As long as you don’t, you know, cross me, I guess.

speaker: Magnus
lines: So- okay, so hold on. The one thing we can’t do, is do what we're not supposed to do, but we don’t know what that is?

speaker: Istus
lines: You'll know—you know what it is.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Cool. I’m still on board. You had me at hello.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, um, she sort of, she—how would she do the—Okay, she knits, she pulls out a new colour of thread from her tunic, and knits it into this scarf. Which you now see like, it doesn’t end, it just kind of fades into maybe another plane, or something like that.

speaker: What you can see is already a very long scarf and she knits this new thread into it, and as she does, these three sigils of Istus appear in front of you—floating in front of you, and they're the same sigils that you've seen the two brothers were wearing, and you saw some of this sort of symbolism—I mean, God, you can see it in this temple whenever you look around you, and it’s kind of a circular symbol with a needle in its centre, with sort of strings represented by these little brass lines that wrap around the needle and the symbol as a whole, and they are essentially little pendants that are floating in front of each of you, one apiece.

speaker: Istus

lines: This orb when smashed will send your consciousness nine seconds into the past. It’s not quite enough to rewrite the fate of all mankind perhaps, but maybe enough time to fix a mistake or save a loved one.

It rattles for a bit and then something comes flying out of it and you recognise it as the minute hand of that clock, which arcs high through the air, and then you just fucking reach one hand up and grab it and claim it and now that it--

speaker: Magnus

speaker: Istus
lines: Okay, we're seriously almost out of time. I have one last blessing for you, my emissaries. Your fate is guiding you, not today, not tomorrow, but to a moment that will challenge you in a new and horrible way and I cannot make the difficult decision that lies at the end of your quest for you, but I can grant you the time that you need to make that decision.

speaker: And it’s quiet, and then a wave of white light--not like flashlight light but like physical light, almost like white milk or something, with these bright sort of rainbow streaks in it, comes pouring out of the cup in a wave, like a literal tall ocean wave, and it washes over everybody in this room and then suddenly the three of you--without Roswell, without Isaak--are in the white space. I could breathe life into entire realities, and shape existence at my master’s will.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And when she says that June kind of gets lost in thought a bit.

lines: In this form, as a cup with a seventh of the power that I once had, I just don’t have that kind of freedom anymore. I have some broad power over time, yeah, but not enough to actually change anything, and I’m hoping that’s where you can come in. I believe that with a user who is determined enough to use me to change the world, I could have the power to change the past and reshape the world, and I promise I’m not gonna do anything to you that you don’t want me to do. I swear it, I’m not gonna cast some thrall over you or whatever. But I truly believe that together we can fix the wrongs in the past, and we can make this world better in the process. So I’m not gonna hypnotise you or anything like that; I’m just asking for the opportunity to make a pitch for you, I just want you to hear me out and then I'll release the girl and then I’ll go with you in peace.
